name: Rekindling our Light
description:
Join us for a community engaged activation of Montgomery’s Inn and the lands that surround it. Through collective storytelling, nature walks, slow art-making and songs, artists Alexandra Iorgu, Alan Colley and Aqua Nibii Waawaaskone, in partnership with Arts Etobicoke, invite the community to co-create, connect to the land and develop a sense of place.

Our guest, Aqua Nibii Waawaaskone will share their favourite original and traditional hand drum songs. All Nations, generations, and walks of life welcome.

Note: Part of the program takes place outside, participants can take part in an accessible nature walk. Snacks and tea will be served.

organizer.name: Alexandra Iorgu with Toronto Arts Council strategic funding, in partnership with Montgomery's Inn

name: Yayoi Kusama's INFINITY MIRRORED ROOM - LET'S SURVIVE FOREVER
description:
Back at the AGO! For over 70 years, Japanese artist Yayoi Kusama (born 1929) has invited audiences to experience her groundbreaking visions of infinity. In the past three decades, Kusama has become a global icon, with her work shown worldwide.

This installation features mirrored spheres suspended from the ceiling and arranged on the floor. A mirrored column inside creates the illusion of a vast, infinite field of silver orbs.

Thanks to the generosity of over 4,700 #InfinityAGO donors and the David Yuile & Mary Elizabeth Hodgson Fund, Kusama’s work is now part of the AGO Collection.
